Issues.Title: Please add registerUntouched on ControlValueAccessor interface
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
This feature request is for @angular/forms


### Description
Custom form field by implementing ControlValueAccessor missing the ability to mark untouched.

For my problem, I encapsulated a input field with a long list of error messages into a custom form field. Inside this custom form field component, it has it's private formControl, handling the validation and error display, etc. If I implement this interface to make a bridge between this private formControl with the outside world formControl, there is no way I can mark that private formControl untouched to clear the error message. So I really need a registerOnUntouched just like registerOnTouched.


### Describe the solution you'd like
Add registerOnUntouch method in ControlValueAccessor interface. Hopefully it's not a big change.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
Not really.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Please add registerUntouched on ControlValueAccessor interface" (#27315)

Issues.Title: ng serve --aot, subsequent compilations are successful regardless of type errors.

# üêû bug report ### Affected Package @angular/cli ### Is this a regression? Yes ### Description if ```ng serve --aot``` successfully compiles the first time, any subsequent **type** errors are ignored. If these **type** errors are present on the first run then it fails to compile as expected. It still prints the type errors when they occur on the console. Issues.Title: HostListener event doesn't react on disabled input with Firefox
Issues.Body:
üêû bug report Hi everyone! I encounter an issue with Firefox, Reactive Forms, and the HostListener decorator. The code is simple: - I have a form with an input - The input is disabled - I listen to the "click" event with the HostListener decorator, and just print something in the console => With Chrome, if I click on the input, the HostListener react and the console print what I want => With Firefox, no reaction, no console print A Stackblitz is worth 71 words : https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-rerzke ### Affected Package - @angular/core - @angular/forms ### Is this a regression? Issues.Title: fix(ivy): support multiple directives with the same selector
Issues.Body:
Previously the concept of multiple directives with the same selector was
not supported by ngtsc. This is due to the treatment of directives for a
component as a Map from selector to the directive, which is an erroneous
representation.

Now the directives for a component are stored as an array which supports
multiple directives with the same selector.

Testing strategy: a new ngtsc_spec test asserts that multiple directives
with the same selector are matched on an element.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): support multiple directives with the same selector" (#27298)

Issues.Title: Refine RouteReuseStrategy
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ RouteReuseStrategy 2.0

### Relevant Package

This feature request is for @angular/router

### Description
The current [`RouteReuseStrategy` API](https://angular.io/api/router/RouteReuseStrategy) is totally confusing and probably broken.

### Describe the solution you'd like

In order for this API to become usable, at least the following problems have to be solved:

* #25521: Introduce `ngOnAttach`/`ngOnDetach` lifecycle hooks
* #20114: impossible to store/retrieve siblings AND ALSO a non-sibling
* #20072: RouteReuseStrategy doesn't reuse the parent tree components
* [Why is `retrieve` called before `shouldAttach`](https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/22475#issuecomment-441914257)?
* There is no 'official' way to properly dispose cached routes. `DetachedRouteHandle` is said to be 'opaque', but to dispose a route one has to use the content of this structure: `(handle as any).componentRef.destroy()`. Does this call suffice to dispose a route? Why not add a public API for this? Also a `(handle as any).componentRef.hostView.destroyed` check has to be used in `retrieve` because of #20072 to avoid reattaching a destroyed component.
* Documentation. More than one sentence for every method and a clear description of their call sequence.
* Code examples (working).
* Ship alternative ready-to-use implementations with the router, not only `DefaultRouteReuseStrategy`. E.g. a greedy strategy that tries to cache and reuse all the routes.


### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds?

The current API makes you use a lot of ugly workarounds, and still you cannot be sure whether you've done everything right. E.g. see [my attempt to implement](https://stackblitz.com/github/thorn0/angular-router-experiments?file=src%2Fapp%2Fcustom-reuse-strategy.ts) the greedy reuse strategy.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Refine RouteReuseStrategy" (#27290)

Issues.Title: Moving/Renaming CSS resources breaks ServiceWorker caching
Issues.Body:
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] bug report -> please search issues before submitting
- [x] feature request
```

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [x] build
```

### Versions
```
> node --version
v10.13.0
```
```
> npm --version
6.4.1
```
```
> ng --version
Angular CLI: 7.1.0
Node: 10.13.0
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 7.1.0
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router, service-worker

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.11.0
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.11.0
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.11.0
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.11.0
@angular-devkit/core              7.1.0
@angular-devkit/schematics        7.1.0
@angular/pwa                      0.11.0
@ngtools/webpack                  7.1.0
@schematics/angular               7.1.0
@schematics/update                0.11.0
rxjs                              6.3.3
typescript                        3.1.6
webpack                           4.23.1
```

Windows 10


### Repro steps

1. Create a PWA and use an image in CSS (e.g. as background):
```
ng new test-app
cd test-app
ng add @angular/pwa
npm install http-server --save-dev
node --print "'body { background: url(assets/icons/icon-72x72.png); }'" >> src/styles.css
```

2. Serve with ServiceWorker:
```
ng build --prod
node_modules/.bin/http-server dist/test-app -p 4200 -o
```

3. Go offline (e.g. open `DevTools > Network` and check "Offline"):

4. Reload page.

Result: There is no background :sob:


### Desired functionality
There should be background üåû
(See below.)


### Mention any other details that might be useful
Basically, the issue is that we configure the SW (in `ngsw-config.json`) to cache specific resources and make them available offline. In this case, the `/assets/**` files are configured to be cached by default. Since the CSS references an image inside `assets/`, one would expect it to be available offline without any further configuration.

Instead, the image is moved to the root output directory during the build (and renamed to include the hash) and the CSS is rewritten to look for that top-level image. This works fine as long as there is network connectivity, but the SW is not configured to cache this top-level image. As soon as the user goes offline, the image is not available any more (since the SW cannot provide it) and the nice background is gone üò¢

It is easy to fix the issue once you knwo what it is (e.g. by configuring the SW to cache the resulting file or using absolute path in CSS, which are not affected). But the problem is hard to find (e.g. usually there are no tests for how the app behaves in offline mode) and not straight forward to diagnose (i.e. you have to know about the rewriting).

@filipesilva suggested that the SW config should modified to account for the moved/renamed files.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Moving/Renaming CSS resources breaks ServiceWorker caching" (#13067)

Issues.Title: feat(@schematics/angular): consistent naming of options and arguments that do the same thing
Issues.Body:
feat(@schematics/angular): consistent naming of options and arguments that do the same thing

This aligns options that do the same thing:
1) `skipTests` and `spec` has been deprecated in favor of `skipSpecs` since `Tests` is a broader term.
2) `style` and `styleext` has been deprecated in favor of `styleExt` since the latest is two words.
3) `styleExt` now only accepts an enum, valid inputs are "css", "scss", "sass", "less" and "styl".

Fixes #12784


build: don't upper case quicktype acronyms  ‚Ä¶
Acronyms that are in this list gets upper cased by default in quicktype
https://github.com/quicktype/quicktype/blob/master/src/quicktype-core/support/Acronyms.ts#L4

For example instead of
```
export enum StyleExt {
 Css,
 Scss
}
```

we end up with something like

```
export enum StyleEXT {
 CSS,
 Scss
}
```

This is a workaround to not upper case acronyms though it does use a number of private methods from quick type
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@schematics/angular): consistent naming of options and arguments that do the same thing" (#13049)

Issues.Title: build: add support for `x-deprecated` when generating schema
Issues.Body:
When using the CLI and a property is deprecated we emit a warning by using the `x-deprecated` field. However API consumers have no way to know that a property is deprecated at the moment.

This converts `x-deprecated` to  `@deprecated` comments
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: add support for `x-deprecated` when generating schema" (#13048)

Issues.Title: Docs need a simple tree example
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
feature request

#### What is the expected behavior?
Docs show the most simple example, and builds on it progressively to be more featureful. I want to see what the data needs to look like in its most minimal basic form. [The examples for mat-table](https://material.angular.io/components/table/examples) do this very well, with the first example being the simplest (34 lines of typescript).

#### What is the current behavior?
There aren't any simple trees in the docs. They're all nested, have injectable recursive functions to massage data, checkboxes, lazy/dynamic loading, etc. The first example has 139 lines of ts. This is difficult to digest.

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
Reduced learning curve

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Material 7.0.3

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Docs need a simple tree example" (#14297)

Issues.Title: Need a way to configure animations on material components
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Would it be possible to make animations used for angular material elements configurable?

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
We were previously on angular 6 using material design and it looked quite good. After migrating to angular 7 animations of most elements change and it looks a lot worse to us. We would like not to be limited in upgrading to newer versions just because some UI specific things changed. It would be great to keep animations from angular material 6 while in angular material 7. E.g. have injectable animation configuration or have some kind of themes for it.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular 7.1.0
Typescript 3.1.0
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Need a way to configure animations on material components" (#14293)

Issues.Title: Mat Dialog: beforeClosed() should have an option to cancel
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Feature Request

#### What is the expected behavior?
It should be possible to cancel the close event.

#### What is the current behavior?
It is not possible to cancel the close event.

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
Use-case: Dialog with Form Model which will be sent to the server. So for example, the result of the this server call is an error, which should be displayed inside the dialog and prevent it from closing. Right now, this is only possible if I put the logic (store or service calls) inside the dialog component. This isn‚Äôt following the dumb and smart components pattern, where the logic should be put inside the container component.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular 7, Angular Material 7

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Mat Dialog: beforeClosed() should have an option to cancel " (#14292)

Issues.Title: datepicker: shows date using provided LOCALE_ID but parses date using default US locale (or a combination of them)
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Bug. I don't think it is working like that on purpose.

#### What is the expected behavior?
Date picker uses provided en-GB LOCALE_ID for parsing typed in date - 27/10/2018 input manually by typing is valid 

#### What is the current behavior?
Typed date is parsed using US locale -  27/10/2018 input manually is invalid, 12/01/2018 is December, not January.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-datepicker-locale?file=main.ts

1. Select 27/10/2018 using date picker.
2. Modify the date by editing the input to 26/10/2018
3. Observe invalid input

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
Make material datepicker great again! But seriously: it seems like if a culture is provided it should affect both parsing and formatting aspects of dealing with dates and not format it into a date which is considered invalid when updated by typing.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
As in demo: Angular 7.1.0 Material 7.1.0. It fails validation on chrome if day (month?) is over 12, but on IE 11 is more curious as it modifies the year, I am fairly sure the swap issue causes it to work incorrectly on any browser.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
I think it may have been an issue with parsing the text date from text - it seems like it would parse using US culture ignoring provided locale.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "datepicker: shows date using provided LOCALE_ID but parses date using default US locale (or a combination of them)" (#14291)

Issues.Title: content in a drag drop component becomes blurry at non-default zoom on linux
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Bug

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
1. open https://material.angular.io/cdk/drag-drop/overview on chrome 70+ on linux
2. zoom to 110%
3. drag the box in the first example around and notice that sometimes it's blurry (it should never get blurry)

The blurriness becomes more frequent/easier to spot if you change the font in the dialog box to 13px (it's at 14px by default). Still, it varies depending on the exact dragged spot, making me think this could be due to some sort of aliasing issue with how the position is set while dragging.

I'm told this also happens at lower and higher zoom levels (though things look fine at 100%).

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Affected: Linux, Chrome 70
Not affected: Chrome OS, 

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Original internal issue for reference b/120034512
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "content in a drag drop component becomes blurry at non-default zoom on linux" (#14283)

Issues.Title: (CdkDrag): Add Parent Container functionality for Draggable elements
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Add functionality to define a parent container for a draggable element to be constrained to to prevent dragging off bounds.

#### What is the expected behavior?
Be able to define a parent container with a selector , ( e.g cdkDragParent ) so that a draggable element can not be dragged outside the container.

#### What is the current behavior?
You are able to drag items off screen leaving you no way to bring it back into view without refreshing the page. 

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Issue is visible in the demo section for Material:

1) Visit: https://material.angular.io/cdk/drag-drop/overview

2) Scroll down to "Alternate drag root element" section.

3) Click on "Open a draggable dialog" button.

4) Drag the modal off screen, and click anywhere to close it.

5) Click on "Open a draggable dialog" button again.


#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
I am using cdkDrag for draggable modals.  Although I have no need for the "drop" feature of cdkDrag it would be very helpful to be able to define containers that a draggable item could be constrained to.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular 6.0.3,
CDK 7.0.0,
Typescript 2.7.2

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "(CdkDrag): Add Parent Container functionality for Draggable elements" (#14282)

Issues.Title: matTooltip does not reliably disappear when closing matSelect with ESC
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Bug

#### What is the expected behavior?
If a mat-option inside a mat-select panel has a matTooltip applied to it, and the tooltip is being shown, closing the mat-select should cause that tooltip to disappear.

#### What is the current behavior?
If the select panel is closed using the ESC key, and the mouse does not move during closing, the tooltip can remain onscreen until the user clicks elsewhere.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
StackBlitz: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-1paubu

1) Open the select panel and select one of the options
2) Open the panel again, hover over an option so that the tooltip appears
3) Press the ESC key to close the panel. Don't move the mouse while it is closing
4) The tooltip should still be visible after the panel has closed. It will remain visible until you click somewhere else.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?

Angular Material 7.1.0
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "matTooltip does not reliably disappear when closing matSelect with ESC" (#14278)
